ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Experimental Methods is a course that teaches a basic understanding of the many techniques and tools used throughout the field of neuroscience. It's an excellent course for students interested in neuroscience or students just beginning their neuroscience careers.
It is a great course if you are not very sure about what kind of technique you are going to engage yourself in. But even if you have already figured it out, it doesn't hurt to know more.
A very good course with general introduction and discussion on almost all available methods in neuroscience.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I think I covered it in the previous questions already.

For me, I have already decidedmy thesis research topic. And many of the techniques I learn in this course will not be part of my research. Still I think taking this course is helpful in terms of letting me know things that I usually won't be able to spend time on.
It allows me to familiarize myself with different experimental methods which will certainly help me with my own research in the future.
